data.title: Concerts in Philadelphia for 2024 - Upcoming Concert Calendar
data.meta_description: Some of the biggest names in music are touring through Philly in 2024. View our comprehensive list of upcoming concerts and music fests!
data.text:
Summer is peak concert time in Philadelphia. The sun is shining, temps are rising and open-air venues all over the city welcome top-tier talent to the stage.

The concert calendar is looking especially stacked with names like Missy Elliott, Olivia Rodrigo, P!NK and Bruce Springsteen all slated for the coming months.

Festival season hits its stride with a homegrown event, the Lancaster Avenue Jazz & Arts Festival, which returns to West Philly for the annual celebration of jazz music, plus local vendors and food trucks. Fans of heavier music can head to Underground Arts and Franklin Music Hall for This is Hardcore, a festival dedicated to none other than hardcore.

Even post-summer the concerts show no sign of slowing down. Charli XCX and Troye Sivan, Billie Eilish and Justin Timberlake are coming to town this fall.

Why go home after the encore? Book the Visit Philly Overnight Package and get free hotel parking and choose-your-own-adventure perks, including two tickets to The Franklin Institute, the Philadelphia Museum of Art, or the National Constitution Center and the Museum of the American Revolution. Or get cozy with the new Visit Philly 3-Day Stay hotel package, which includes buy-two-get-a-third-free hotel nights at participating hotels.

Looking for more great concerts? WXPN’s concert calendar is your go-to stop for awesome concerts every day of the week in Greater Philadelphia.

Below, find the top concerts headed to Philly for 2024 — and check back often for updates throughout the year.

Go, get your freak on. The absolutely legendary Missy Elliott is embarking on her first-ever headlining tour after three decades in the biz. Along for the ride are frequent collaborators Ciara, Busta Rhymes and Timbaland. Will we get live versions of Lose Control and 1, 2 Step?

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

August 6 & 7, 2024

A little over a year after playing the Wells Fargo Center, Zach Bryan levels up yet again to take on Lincoln Financial Field. Bryan had a busy 2023: He released his fourth album (which debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard 200) and an EP, and he also won the Academy of Country Music Award for new male artist of the year.

Where: Lincoln Financial Field, One Lincoln Financial Field Way

read more

Sponsored

Sponsored

Now in its fifth year, this traveling emo, pop-punk, and alternative rock festival stops in Philly for a full day of music and summer fun. This year, the festival is headlined by the bands Mayday Parade and The Maine with performances by The Wonder Years, We the Kings, Real Friends, Knuckle Puck, Daisy Grenade, Hot Milk, and Diva Bleach. General admission is standing room only, so be sure to bring a blanket and comfy shoes.

Where: The Mann Center, 5201 Parkside Avenue

read more

Continuing his Gravel & Gold Tour from last summer, the country musician performs hits from every era of his 20-year career, like What Was I Thinkin’, Drunk On A Plane and Gold.

Where: Freedom Mortgage Pavilion, 1 Harbour Boulevard, Camden, NJ

read more

August 21 & 23, 2024

After illness forced The Boss to postpone last summer’s Philly tour dates, Bruce Springsteen makes good on his word with these rescheduled dates at Citizens Bank Park. All previous tickets will be honored for the new dates. If you slept on buying tickets the first time around, now’s your chance to get in on the glory days.

Where: Citizens Bank Park, 1 Citizens Bank Way

read more

Come to their window — er, The Mann Center to see an epic pairing of Melissa Etheridge and Indigo Girls. Whether you’re into smoky vocals or folk harmonies, you’ll get a sampling of the best the ‘90s has to offer.

Where: The Mann Center, 5201 Parkside Avenue

read more

Where were you in 2001? Alt-rock band Incubus was releasing Morning View, the band’s hit album that catapulted it to mainstream popularity and spawned a ton of hits including Wish You Were Here, Nice To Know You and Warning. The group, joined by the band Coheed and Cambria, returns to the City of Brotherly Love this August to celebrate its recent re-recording of the album. The audience can enjoy a live performance of the entire album from front to back with a sprinkling of some other hits in between.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

She’s every woman. Chaka Khan’s 50-year career encompasses her time in Rufus (perhaps you’ve heard Tell Me Something Good?) and her solo work, including timeless disco, R&B, funk, and soul hits, like I’m Every Woman, I Feel For You and Through The Fire.

Where: The Dell Music Center, 2400 Strawberry Mansion Drive

read more

The dreamy indie rock band has blown up since its beginnings as 2010s blog favorites. Vocalist Greg Gonzalez’s voice hits that sweet spot between ethereal and hushed, which gives the songs an air of secrecy. They’re now headlining arenas in support of their third album X’s.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

Tems only released her debut album this year but has already collaborated with Wizkid, Drake, Future and Beyonce, won a Grammy and been nominated for an Academy Award for co-writing Lift Me Up with Rihanna. Hear the Nigerian songwriter’s rich, velvety vocals in person at her first headlining tour.

Where: The Met Philadelphia, 858 N. Broad Street

read more

Ever since she released All About That Bass a decade ago, there’s been no stopping Meghan Trainor. She’s won a Grammy, released a bevy of radio-friendly hits like No Excuses and Made You Look, wrote a book and recorded five albums in the process. The latest, Timeless, is the focus of her current tour.

Where: The Mann Center, 5201 Parkside Avenue

read more

Twenty One Pilots have played with a number of sonic styles and textures over their decade-long career, including rap, pop, reggae, psychedelic and funk. Their most recent album concludes a conceptual three-album arc full of lore, named after a character they introduced in 2018: Clancy.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

Over a dozen locations in Montgomery County, including the Ardmore Music Hall, Elmwood Park Zoo and the King of Prussia Mall, host jazz performers for the weekend during the third annual Montco Jazz Fest. Expect representation from a range of performance styles from big band to smooth jazz.

Where: Various locations including Ardmore Music Hall, 23 E. Lancaster Avenue, Ardmore

read more

Maxwell, one of the forebears of neo-soul, hits all the right notes. (Yes, even the high ones.) Get ready to groove and sway all night to songs like Sumthin’ Sumthin’ and Fortunate. Even better? Philly native Jazmine Sullivan is also on the bill.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

She’s your favorite reference, baby. Charli XCX tours behind her new album of electropop club bangers, brat, which manages to be both bombastic and self-reflective at the same time. Co-headliner Troye Sivan’s 2023 album Something to Give Each Other has similar vibes: incredibly dancy, incredibly catchy.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

Relative newcomer to música mexicana, Peso Pluma mixes elements from traditional Mexican music with heavy-hitting, modern trap production styles. The singer has already gained enormous success and multiple Billboard Top 200 hits, including El Belicón, Siempre Pendientes, and AMG. Come prepared for a lively, high-energy night at the Wells Fargo Center with the charismatic singer. (Note: This is a rescheduled concert, originally slated for June.)

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

— Photo by T. Owyoung

2024 Grammy winner for best new artist, Jelly Roll makes his way to Philly this October with his Beautifully Broken tour. The singer-songwriter scored viral success with songs like Dead Man Walking and Son of a Sinner and is known for crisscrossing genres in his music from country to rap and rock with ease. Fans from all backgrounds connect with his honest lyrics and moving life story.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

Justin Timberlake brought sexy back and now he’s bringing his talents back to Philly for the first time in five years. The Forget Tomorrow World Tour began way back in April to sold out crowds and is still going strong many months later. The setlist includes throwbacks like Cry Me A River and SexyBack plus songs from his new album Everything I Thought It Was.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

Maggie Rogers’ voice is like a hug: warm and all encompassing. Her latest album Don’t Forget Me bears similarities to prolific singer-songwriters like Sharon Van Etten and Linda Ronstadt. Rogers’ intimate songs will fill up the huge arena space at Wells Fargo Center for a cozy fall concert.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

Continuing the group’s Future Past tour into 2024, heavy metal rockers Iron Maiden bring out the pyrotechnics, riffs and theatrical vocals to the Wells Fargo Center.

Where: Wells Fargo Center, 3601 S. Broad Street

read more

FAQs About Concerts in Philadelphia

The Visit Philly Overnight Package offers free hotel parking as well as choose-your-own-adventure perks like free attraction tickets. Better yet, make it a long weekend with the 3-Day Stay Package, where guests buy two Philly hotel nights and get a third night for free. (Yes, free.)

read more

So much! See world-famous art at our storied museums, shop till you drop and, of course, have a cheesesteak.

read more

Come for Philadelphia. Stay (Over) for Philly.

The only way to fully experience Philly? Stay over.

Book the Visit Philly Overnight Package and get free hotel parking and choose-your-own-adventure perks, including tickets to the Philadelphia Museum of Art, The Franklin Institute, or the National Constitution Center and the Museum of the American Revolution.

Or maybe you’d prefer to buy two Philly hotel nights and get a third night for free? Then book the new Visit Philly 3-Day Stay package.

Which will you choose?

book now
